intro: Leichhardtia grandis, commonly known as the large leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or rainforest habitats. Leichhardtia grandis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
